Definitely faking it. Unless God's going "hey, I pity you so here's a good novel", it has to be the sister faking her age regression because she felt guilty about ruining his life (albeit without that intention) by being better at him at everything, so she can spend more time with him by faking stupidity she can also support his life by anonymously sending him the next novels.
It's sad that she resorted to such a method to fix their relationship but there's a happy fact in the idea that she's willing to do it all to be with him again.

@Chisami_22 it's a narrative device. It's supposed to be a line of the writing he's putting his name on (see a couple pages before the end), but it's doubling as a question to his last statement. By drawing the reader's eye to that, they're subtly saying "are you both actually happy?" ...But this being a doujinshi, most people ignore plot to appreciate a girl/guy/whatever twisted image some people want to get off to getting plowed.

Definetly pretending after all she is a genius and her goal was to get closer to him. Therefore she threwherself down the stairs to give herself an excuse to pretend to be regressed. Afterall there's no point in going so far if you don't really savour the fruits of your effort, for example if she truly did lose her sense of self the "new" her that arose may not be compatible either making the whole effort pointless. So she has to be pretending but just needed a reason to act in a new way and now supports his life as a novelist from the shadows.

At first I thought maybe she set up the emails to send automatically after a set amount of time, but I definitely think she's faking her regression just to make her beloved onii-chan happy. I also felt really bad for her until I got to the end, and now I think she's such a genius she is able to fool EVERYONE into doing what she wants while not coming off like she's a smartass brat. If I had to guess as to how this would progress, she eventually starts "regaining" her senses but is able to do so in a way that she can still be in a relationship with her brother.

It doesn't take a genius to figure out that it's a ruse, and that his sister's the one sending him random excerpts for his novel. Trying to be clever in a doujin, probably not the best approach.   >.>

Well, if it follows the principle of Chekhov's Gun, then since a whole 3 pages and the entire end of the story focus on a mysterious series of emails sent to him that happen to win him novelist competitions that he happened to complain to his sister about losing to her over, I'll go ahead and assume that it's just Iroha pretending to be handicapped to both give him success and her his attention
